description.brief: A mountainous island kingdom of iron and stone, ruled by dragon-blooded warriors and devoted to Korthak, where strength and honor are the highest virtues.
description.detailed: Korthak's Isle rises from the western waters as a fortress of iron peaks and dragon-carved stone. The island is dominated by massive training grounds, fighting arenas, and forges where both weapons and warriors are tempered. This kingdom serves as the ultimate proving ground for those who seek strength through honest effort and direct confrontation. Dragon-King Ironscale, blessed with Korthak's own draconic might, rules over a society where physical prowess and unwavering honor determine one's place. The kingdom's culture revolves around the belief that true strength comes only through facing challenges head-on, without tricks or shortcuts, and that honor in combat is the highest virtue.
description.atmosphere: The constant sound of training weapons, dragon roars echoing from mountain peaks, and an air thick with the determination of those who refuse to yield

geography.terrain: Iron-rich mountains with vast training plateaus and dragon roosts carved into cliffsides
geography.climate: Cool and crisp with strong winds that test endurance and strength
geography.borders: Northwestern waters, connected to Midgardland by the Honor Straits

kingdom_structure.government: Meritocratic monarchy based on proven strength, combat skill, and unwavering honor

ruler.name: Dragon-King Ironscale the Unyielding
ruler.title: The Eternal Champion, Master of All Combat
ruler.description: A warrior blessed with Korthak's draconic essence, possessing scales of living iron and the ability to transform into dragon form. He has never lost a fair fight and embodies the principle of strength through honor.
ruler.personality: Absolutely honorable and direct, respects all who fight with courage, believes that true strength can only be earned through honest effort and pain

kingdom_structure.nobility: Champions who have proven themselves in the Great Arena and masters of various combat disciplines
kingdom_structure.military: The Iron Legion - elite warriors trained in every form of combat, supported by dragon riders and siege specialists

traditions: The Great Trials - annual competitions where citizens prove their growth in strength and skill
Honor Duels - formal combats to resolve disputes and demonstrate character
Dragon Bonding - ceremonies where worthy warriors attempt to bond with dragons
specializations: Master-level training in all forms of combat and weapons
Smithing weapons and armor of legendary quality
Tactical warfare and honorable battle strategies

major_cities.name: The Iron Crown
major_cities.description: Built into the highest mountain peak with the Great Arena at its center, surrounded by training grounds, forges, and dragon roosts

major_cities.name: Stronghaven
major_cities.role: Harbor fortress and naval training center
major_cities.description: Coastal fortress-city where naval warriors train and the kingdom's war fleets are maintained and supplied

major_cities.name: The Proving Grounds
major_cities.description: Vast complex of specialized training areas where warriors from across the realms come to test their skills against the best

divine_manifestations: Dragon roars that inspire courage and test worthiness
Weapons and armor that grow stronger through honorable use
Physical enhancement that responds to dedicated training
Dragons that serve as partners to the truly worthy
sacred_sites: The Great Arena - where Korthak himself sometimes appears to test champions
Dragon's Rest - the highest peak where ancient dragons make their homes
The Forge of Trials - where legendary weapons are created through strength alone

relationships.midgardland: Strong military alliance and training partnership, especially through Korthak's Gate (Drakmorth)
relationships.other_kingdoms: Respected for military prowess but sometimes seen as overly direct and inflexible
relationships.diplomatic_stance: Honest and straightforward in all dealings, will defend allies but refuses to use deception or trickery
